I am using Plotly to create a line plot and I have the following code. However, I want to set the range of the Y axis to always be in the range [0; 10]. How can I do this?

```python
layout = go.Layout(
        title=go.layout.Title(
            text="Test",
            xref='paper',
            x=0
        ),
        xaxis=go.layout.XAxis(
            tickmode='linear',
            tickfont=dict(
                size=10
            ),
            title=go.layout.xaxis.Title(
                font=dict(
                    size=14,
                    color='#7f7f7f'
                )
            )
        ),
        yaxis=go.layout.YAxis(
            title=go.layout.yaxis.Title(
                text=y,
                font=dict(
                    size=14,
                    color='#7f7f7f'
                )
            )
        )
    )

    data = [go.Scatter(x=x1, y=y1)]
```

To set the range of the Y-axis to always be within [0, 10], you need to specify the `range` parameter within the `yaxis` part of your `layout`. Here is how you can modify your code to achieve this:

```python
import plotly.graph_objs as go

layout = go.Layout(
    title=go.layout.Title(
        text="Test",
        xref='paper',
        x=0
    ),
    xaxis=go.layout.XAxis(
        tickmode='linear',
        tickfont=dict(
            size=10
        ),
        title=go.layout.xaxis.Title(
            font=dict(
                size=14,
                color='#7f7f7f'
            )
        )
    ),
    yaxis=go.layout.YAxis(
        title=go.layout.yaxis.Title(
            text='Y Axis Title',  # Replace 'Y Axis Title' with the actual title you want
            font=dict(
                size=14,
                color='#7f7f7f'
            )
        ),
        range=[0, 10]  # Set the range for Y-axis
    )
)

data = [go.Scatter(x=x1, y=y1)]

fig = go.Figure(data=data, layout=layout)
fig.show()
```

Make sure to replace `'Y Axis Title'` with the actual title you intend to use for the Y-axis. This will set the Y-axis range to always be between 0 and 10, regardless of the data values.
